reviews.text: Wowo is pretty good as far as family orientated campsites go. Plenty of things for the little ones to do on site and a decent pub (The Sloop) not too far a walk a way. There's also a new 'village center' are that's been put up where the soup evenings take place (such is the demand for this event).
reviews.title: decent family orientated campsite

reviews.text: They actively encourage campfires (each pitch is centered around a 'fire pit' area) and sell firewood on site. This is a real plus, as there's nothing quite like sitting around a roaring campfire on a clear summer's evening. They also operate an honesty system once the office has closed, which means it's very easy to go back and top up on firewood if you find yourself running low later in the evening.
reviews.title: Head the warnings of others. Avoid like a badly maintained composting toilet!

reviews.text: The shower and toilet blocks are pretty poor though. Trying to get a shower without being scalded by the intermittently boiling/freezing on/off water supply is not a fun experience! Having been here a couple of years in a row now, I don't really understand why they haven't done anything about this.
reviews.title: Say NO NO to WoWo!
Camp No No
reviews.text: I'd say this place is definitely experienced in large groups, i.e. at least two family groups together, as if you're not then you'll find most other people staying here are and you can easily get swamped by all the other groups of children running around the place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In any case, the kids loved it, so I'm sure we'll be back.
reviews.title: Wow Wow not WoWo

reviews.text: We rented the Alice in Wonderland yurt over the weekend of 18th May for myself, husband and 3 year old.
reviews.title: Alright but could do with some improvement

reviews.text: The yurt in itself was lovely and well stocked - lots of cooking equipment, utensils, blankets and hot water bottles! Lovely double bed and a nice double futon for my daughter. Log burning stove that once you got going kicked out a really nice heat so no issues with being cold. Could have done with a little spring clean as the cool box supplied had 3 large dead spiders that looked like they had been there for a while and there was rubbish under the bed from a previous occupant - but generally good accommodation wise.
reviews.title: Wapsbourne campsite...Unsafe & unclean

reviews.text: Only thing with this yurt is that the main road through the campsite runs directly behind it so there was a lot of noise and generally quite a high footfall right outside. Also, there are not curtains at the 2 windows so we ended up putting towels over them as people kept walking right past the window and looking in - not something you get when you are in a normal tent and not good when you are trying to get dressed/undressed!
reviews.title: Its Camping people! not 5star in Vegas.

reviews.text: They give you a list of rules when you check out but I think one needs to be added - respect other campers privacy and space! The yurt was surrounded by wood chip which clearly marked out the boundry of your space but adults and children alike seemed to think it was acceptable to use the side of the yurt next the the river as a short cut to get to the next field at all hours of the day and night.
reviews.title: Lovely location

reviews.text: The things I felt were a let down were the toilet/shower facilities and the fridges provided in the main barn.
reviews.title: Used to be lovely...

reviews.text: After finding this campsite on the Internet, we booked a pitch (stepping stones) in the tipi trail. It was big enough for two family tents (5 man) and we stayed here with our 2 boys (1 & 3yrs old) along with our friends and their 2yrs old daughter.
reviews.title: Fantastic place, we will return....

reviews.text: I did read the reviews on here before going, but we weren't put off. We know we are going camping, and don't expect much in the way of "hotel" style facilities. If we did, we would book into a hotel!
reviews.title: We loved the site - wont be back-

reviews.text: We were lucky with the weather as it was sunny all weekend. In response to another review on here, maybe they should have charged us more because the weather was nice, as opposed to giving us a refund if it was raining!!?
reviews.title: Enjoy the campfires, rope swings and brook. Don't expect good facilities
Great basics, bad attitude
reviews.text: The pitch cost £20 and we paid an extra £10 for firewood. we were able to park the car about 20 meters from our woodland pitch, and at no extra charge.

reviews.title: Over-rated and over priced
reviews.text: The compost toilets could have been emptied more often, but we didn't find it a problem. There was washing up facilities in every field, and the main Barn area had decent toilets and showers.

Wowo does exactly what it says on the tin. It's a relatively basic camping experience with just the right amount of "facilities". If you like a more laid back approach to camping (we do) this is just the right spot for you.
reviews.title: Mud, wood smoke and lots of happy smiles

reviews.text: It's in a beautiful spot with 3 or more fields to choose from. The middle field has a communal area which serves up breakfast for a fiver and free soup and bread on a Saturday evening with a bit of live acoustic music thrown in. The sites have compost loos which are perfectly clean, stocked with toilet paper, and only a little bit smelly :-) They also have a pot wash block but only cold water there until they get the hot water hooked up. Down by the main reception there are plenty of sinks and hot water and a shower and some more conventional flushing toilets.
reviews.title: We liked it!

reviews.text: Dogs are welcome and most I saw were under control and off the lead (ours was mostly). Poop bags are provided and you chuck them in the compost loos (very simple). The walk to the sloop pub took 40 minutes with a 4 year old in tow and served good food.
reviews.title: A lovely lovely place to stay!

reviews.text: Wowo staff are welcoming, helpful and very happy.
reviews.title: Real camping (fires!), amazing location and surrounds for kids

reviews.text: For the kids theres open space, water, mud, rope swings, branches across the stream to fall off, slopes to skid down and fire to toast marshmallows.
reviews.title: Good old school campsite
